thread.title: Bonds weaker as share market bounce
thread.title_full: Bonds weaker as share market bounce

title: Bonds weaker as share market bounce
text:
Fri, Aug 28, 2015, 5:20 PM AEST - Australia Markets closed Bonds weaker as share market bounce AAP â€“ 32 minutes ago Print 
The Australian bond market is weaker as local and Asian share markets enjoy a strong rebound from losses made earlier in the week. 
Nomura head of macro products Jon Linton said the day was one of stability, with demand for safe haven assets falling as traders move into riskier assets. 
"It feels like some of the frenzy and fear has dissipated," he said. 
"The actions by Chinese authorities - the supporting of the market and the cutting of interest rates - seems to have calmed things down." 
Mr Linton said the fact that the Australian government will continue to issue longer dated bonds will help support the bond market into the future. 
Next week's raft of local economic data, including gross domestic product figures on Wednesday, will also be influential. 
"We are expecting a soft GDP next week, which will act as a support for the local bond market," Mr Linton said. 
At 1630 AEST on Friday, the September 2015 10-year bond futures contract was trading at 97.235 (implying a yield of 2.765 per cent), down from 97.260 (2.740 per cent) on Thursday. 
The September 2015 three-year bond futures contract was at 98.170 (1.830 per cent), down from 98.210 (1.790 per cent). 
KEY MOVEMENTS: 
* CGS 5.5pct Jan 2018, 1.798pct, from 1.767pct on Thursday 
* CGS 4.25pct April 2026, 2.804pct, from 2.783pct 
Sydney Futures Exchange prices: 
* September 2015 bill futures, 97.900 from 97.910 
* December 2015 bill futures, 98.040, from 98.060 
(*Closes taken at 1630 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
